availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Schenk (Louisville, Kentucky, upholsterer and saloon proprietor)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, upholsterer and saloon proprietor. Native of Hesse. Married to Alexandra Schenk. Father of Eliza Schenk, George Schenk, and Bertha Schenk. Married to Angeline Kritzky Schenk in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on January 17, 1863. Carpet weaver in Louisville in 1858. Upholsterer in Louisville in 1860. Upholsterer in Louisville in 1861. Upholsterer in Louisville in 1863. Proprietor of the Apollo Hall Saloon in Louisville in 1865.
